result.execSummary:
The defendant Janell E Kortsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (bars, taverns or liquor stores)
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

Case 14CF1394 was dismissed and read into: 14CF981.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - COMMENCE FORTHWITH. First 9 months STRAIGHT TIME, last 3 months with Huber-nonworking hours with standard release.
Credit for 57 days.
AMENDED 07-09-2015:  The 57 days sentence credit to be applied to STRAIGHT TIME.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 503 days were granted.
AMENDED 12/07/2018 Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
All costs previously imposed are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Inform agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Janell E Kortsch in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Sentence Withheld for 4 years Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Absolute Sobriety and Random U.A.'s. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores). DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 1 year Condition Time commencing forthwith. 1st 9 months straight time and last 3 months with huber -nonworking hours with standard release conditions.  57 days credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
